summary: The Falkland Islands, located in the South Atlantic Ocean, are a group of islands governed by the United Kingdom but claimed by Argentina. The islands include East Falkland, West Falkland, and many smaller ones. The capital is Stanley. People who live there are mostly of British descent and speak English. The islands have a unique mix of wildlife but face challenges due to introduced species. The economy relies on fishing, tourism, and sheep farming. There's also ongoing debate about oil exploration due to disputes with Argentina. In 2013, most residents voted to stay a UK territory.
title: Falkland Islands
